An FIR has been filed against the builders of MZ Wishtown Planners and Lotus Greens Construction for negligence. The lack of proper fencing and visibility turned the plot into a fatal trap, leading to the young engineer's untimely death.

Publishing in the age of infinite voices: curation or chaos?
description: A conversation on navigating abundance and how editors and publishers shape meaning, amplify voices, and find coherence in an era of endless stories. Elizabeth Kuruvilla, Kanishka Gupta, and Manasi Subramaniam in conversation with Rosella Stephen

title: The Hindu relaunches its Games section
AAI submits report to WRD on building elevated corridor
description: AAI officials said the State government had called for a study to assess whether the pillars of the proposed elevated corridor from Thandalam will obstruct flow of water in the Adyar river

title: Why dieting made us fat: On weight loss, metabolism and why food is not the enemy
description: A conversation unpacking diet culture, metabolism myths, and a commonsense approach to eating that restores balance without fear or fads. Rujuta Diwekar in discussion with Shonali Muthalaly.

title: Poetry competition winners awarded
description: Prakriti Foundation’s ‘Poetry with Prakriti’ competition invited new and young poets to submit original poems

title: Exclusive: Investigation into Cambodia job scam points to a Pakistan link
Akasa chaos: Pune–Ahmedabad flyers' 11-hour wait ends in cancellation
description: Over 150 passengers endured an 11-hour ordeal on an Akasa Air flight from Pune to Ahmedabad due to significant delays, poor communication, and gate changes. The flight was eventually cancelled, with passengers offered refunds or a rescheduled flight the next morning, facing last-minute fare hikes and logistical issues.

title: Delhi air turns ‘severe’, may see slight improvement today
MP man bathes in funeral pyre ashes, takes skull, bones home in plastic bag
description: A man in Datia allegedly bathed in funeral pyre ashes and took a deceased neighbor's skull and bones home. This act led to public humiliation, forced consumption of filth, and a community panchayat-imposed social boycott on him and his family. The man's family claims he was under severe mental stress and influenced by superstition, seeking children.

title: George Yong-Boon Yeo: ‘Trump is a bully. If you show weakness, he’ll be all over you… be firm but flexible’
Indore’s richest beggar? Man picked up from street turns out to be crorepati
description: A mission to free Indore of beggars unexpectedly revealed a physically disabled man, Mangilal, who amassed crores.  Known for his discreet methods in Sarafa Bazaar, he collected substantial daily earnings. Upon being approached for rehabilitation, Mangilal disclosed ownership of multiple properties, three rented auto-rickshaws, and a car with a driver, exposing a hidden wealth far beyond his street persona.

description: The shipyard will be established on about 29 acres of coastal land on the western side of the Ponnani fishing harbour, making it the second shipyard in the State after Kochi.

description: Minimum temperatures were below normal by one degree Celsius to three degrees Celsius at most places over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal area

Francis Ngannou floors iShowSpeed in playful moment before AFCON final
description: ​​Francis Ngannou dropped iShowSpeed to the ground in a playful moment before the Africa Cup of Nations final in Morocco. The scene, caught on camera, quickly went viral. Their exchange sparked talk of influencer boxing, though no fight is confirmed. Fans around the world reacted as the clip spread fast online.

title: 20-year-old Manipur gang rape survivor dies waiting for justice
description: A young Kuki-Zo woman, just 20 years old, has tragically lost her battle for life after enduring years of torment as a consequence of the ethnic violence that erupted in Manipur. She was kidnapped and assaulted in May 2023—a harrowing incident that has remained stalled in the legal system despite an FIR filed over two years ago.

'Bhabhi bol': Rana recalls how Kohli pulled his leg after meeting Anushka - Watch
description: Harshit Rana recounted a funny moment with Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma.  This happened after India won the 2025 Champions Trophy.  Rana met Anushka Sharma for the first time and called her 'ma'am'. Kohli playfully corrected him, asking him to call her 'Bhabhi'.  The story highlights Kohli's humorous side and ability to keep the team atmosphere light.

title: Travis Kelce’s Trump comment sparks backlash and questions about Taylor Swift
description: Travis Kelce’s pre-Super-Bowl comment calling it an honour to play before the president sparked political backlash. With Donald Trump attending, fans questioned Taylor Swift’s stance. Insiders said Swift was unfazed, stressing Travis Kelce praised the office, not Trump himself. No tension followed. Swift focused on supporting Kelce as the Chiefs chased another Super Bowl title amid intense media scrutiny worldwide buzz.

title: Trump aide Peter Navarro renews attack on Delhi, asks why Americans ‘paying for AI in India’
description: Navarro’s comments came as ties between New Delhi and Washington are reeling under strain on several other issues apart from tariffs

title: IndiGo to inform if it can fly 2k flights daily
description: IndiGo faces a critical deadline this week to confirm its ability to operate over 2,000 daily flights under new, stricter pilot duty rules. Failure to comply could lead to flight cuts, averting a repeat of last December's disruptions. The airline is conducting dry runs to assess its readiness as authorities closely monitor the situation.

title: Fifty years ago | Library as a Public Movement, Jatti’s Call
Smriti Mandhana praises RCB's bowling unit after dominant win over DC
description: Mandhana said chasing made batting easier, as it helped her decide which bowlers to attack and defend against

title: Bengaluru dashcam horror: Man pulls out knife, threatens family in car after spat; held
description: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Bengaluru for threatening a family with a knife after a road rage incident. The alleged offence, captured on a dashcam near Nexus Shantiniketan Mall, showed the accused verbally abusing and then brandishing a knife at the car occupants. The accused, identified as Sayed Arbaz Khan, has a history of previous arrests.

title: Aman Mokhade becomes third batter to score 800-plus runs in single Vijay Hazare Trophy edition
description: Mokhade has scored 814 runs in 10 innings at an average of 90.44, with a strike rate of over 109

title: When winter burns: Uttarakhand to Kashmir, Himalayan forests are catching fire out of season
description: Himalayan forests are experiencing an unprecedented winter fire season, breaking decades of predictable patterns. Uttarakhand has recorded the highest number of fire alerts nationwide since November 1, with December emerging as a particularly active month. Scientists attribute this alarming trend to climate variability intensifying natural fire cycles, indicating a significant ecological shift.

title: Ball girl collapses in Australian Open heat as players rush to help
description: The incident happened as Russian 11th seed Alexandrova was serving in the second set with the girl falling onto her back while standing at the base of the umpire's chair

title: From back office to cutting edge, India emerges as hub for GCCs
description: The availability of a large, cheaper English-speaking IT workforce led foreign firms to begin setting up subsidiaries in the country 40 years ago. Today, multinational companies have deepened their presence in this multi-billion dollar oasis in the job market, with at least one Global Capability Centre being established every week. From playing a supporting role, GCCs are now shaping the business

'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin recently shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI. He emphasized that passion and curiosity, rather than just credentials, drive success, even as AI capabilities grow. Brin also noted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" with proven skills over solely relying on traditional degrees.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife's donations questioned - What it revealed?
description: MacKenzie Scott's ex-wife, Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: A wedding invitation to the clouds: Inside India’s frog marriages
description: Across India, communities perform frog weddings, a folk ritual to invoke rainfall during droughts. These ceremonies, deeply rooted in agrarian life and nature's cycles, blend faith, folklore, and collective belief to cope with climate uncertainty.  The practice persists as a cultural lifeline, reflecting a deep connection with the environment.

title: Forgetting names, losing focus? Neurologist says your brain needs these 5 exercises
description: Small memory lapses and focus issues can signal deeper brain health concerns. Dr. Amit Kumar Agarwal from Amrita Hospital Faridabad suggests simple daily brain exercises. These include mindful attention, memory chunking, dual-tasking, visual memory training, and learning new things. Consistent practice for 15-20 minutes daily can significantly boost cognitive function. Brain training is now essential preventive care.

title: MNS defiant: Raj Thackeray asks corporators to turn civic houses into ‘battlegrounds’
description: MNS chief Raj Thackeray has called on his newly elected corporators to be combative. He acknowledged the party's election results were not as expected. Thackeray stated that corporators must challenge what he called the 'rule of money power'. They are also tasked with opposing policies that harm Marathi interests. The MNS aims to be a strong voice in civic governance.

title: Google vs court ruling: Tech giant refuses to share data with OpenAI
description: Google has asked a judge to delay sharing its data with rivals like OpenAI, challenging a ruling that found the company holds an illegal monopoly in online search. The tech giant argues the order risks exposing trade secrets before its appeal is decided, asserting users choose Google willingly. Google is not seeking to postpone other requirements from the previous orders.

title: Roger Federer revisits Australian Open glory with wife Mirka and kids
description: Roger Federer returned to the 2026 Australian Open with his full family and shared emotional memories from Melbourne. The seven-time champion spoke about reliving past wins, watching old clips, and his children playing with his trophy. Federer also played an exhibition match, giving fans another special moment from the tennis legend.

title: Bill Belichick ESPN Role; UNC Post 4-8" (39 chars). Cuts fluff, retains facts
description: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN’s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina’s head coach ended at 4–8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels’ April 12 spring game.
